Blank, Nightmare Star, Solar Flare, and Gummy, Things Just Got Real are "secret" cards such that they are not listed in the set checklist, but they are still part of the set and still have the same chance to be obtained from booster packs as any other card in the set.

Discord, Master of Chaos is a foiled Fixed card released as a teaser in the Discord Collector's Tin product, and is also released as a Common card in the same set.

In addition to the main set, there is also a foil parallel set of 50 cards. These Foil (f) cards are foiled versions of cards found in the main set but are otherwise the same as their main set equivalent. There is a 1 in 4 chance for a Premiere booster pack to contain a parallel Foil cards in place of a Common card.

The promo set of 15 cards cannot be found in booster packs. Of these 15 Promo (P) cards, 9 of them are foiled versions of cards in the main set and 6 are unique to the set.

Theme decks:


    Double the Fun Theme Deck
    Unlikely Duo Theme Deck

Name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Equestrian Odysseys
Description:
Equestrian Odysseys is the name of the fifth set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: August 28, 2015

218 unique cards were released as part of the main set: 

    10 Mane Characters, 
    112 Friends, 
    32 Events, 
    30 Resources, 
    12 Troublemakers, and 
    22 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains 

    60 Common (C) cards, 
    60 Uncommon (U) cards, 
    60 Rare (R) cards, 
    16 Super Rare (SR) cards, 
    16 Ultra Rare (UR) cards, and 
    6 Fixed (F) cards. 


There is a 1 in 3 chance for an Equestrian Odysseys booster pack to contain a Super Rare, Ultra Rare, or Royal Rare card in place of a Common card.

In addition to the main set, there is also a foil parallel set of 4 cards and 2 Royal Rare (RR) parallel alternate-art full-card cards. These Foil (f) and new Royal Rare (RR) versions are foiled or full-card (borderless) versions of cards found in the main set but are otherwise the same as their main set equivalent. The Foil (f) cards come on the front of the theme decks and there is a 1 in 108 chance for an Equestrian Odysseys booster pack to contain a Royal Rare (RR) in place of a Common card (average of 2 per case of 6 booster boxes of 36 booster packs).

The promo set of 15 cards cannot be found in booster packs. All of these Promo (P) cards are alternate-art foiled versions of cards in the main set (none are unique to the promo set).

Theme Decks:


    Jam Session Theme Deck
    Takin' Care of Business Theme Deck

Name: Patchwork: Automa
Description:
A solo variant with 24 cards for Uwe Rosenberg's 2 player game 
Patchwork included in Lookout Games' customer magazine "Neues vom Ausguck" issue 11, August 2018.

Name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – High Magic
Description:
High Magic is the name of the sixth set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: November 20, 2015

152 unique cards were released as part of the main set: 

    3 Mane Characters, 
    92 Friends, 
    18 Events, 
    15 Resources, 
    5 Troublemakers, and 
    19 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains 

    40 Common (C) cards, 
    41 Uncommon (U) cards, 
    40 Rare (R) cards, 
    12 Super Rare (SR) cards, 
    13 Ultra Rare (UR) cards, and 
    6 Fixed (F) cards. 


There is a 1 in 3 chance for a High Magic booster pack to contain a Super Rare, Ultra Rare, or Royal Rare card in place of a Common card.

In addition to the main set, there is also a foil parallel set of 4 cards and 3 Royal Rare (RR) parallel alternate-art full-card cards. These Foil (f) and Royal Rare (RR) versions are foiled or full-card (borderless) versions of cards found in the main set but are otherwise the same as their main set equivalent. The Foil (f) cards come on the front of the theme decks and there is a 1 in 108 chance for a High Magic booster pack to contain a Royal Rare (RR) in place of a Common card (average of 2 per case of 6 booster boxes of 36 booster packs).

Each theme deck contains two double-sided Token cards that can be put into play via card abilities. They have a unique Token (T) rarity and card number but are not listed on the official High Magic collector's sheet.

The promo set of 14 cards cannot be found in booster packs. All of these Promo (P) cards are alternate-art foiled versions of cards in the main set (none are unique to the promo set).

Theme Decks:


    Chaos is Magic Theme Deck
    Steal the Show Theme Deck

Name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Marks in Time
Description:
Marks in Time is the name of the seventh set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: June 10, 2016

Marks in Time includes

    2 new gameplay mechanics (Dilemmas and Cutie Marking).
    5 new color combinations on dual-color cards, rounding out all 15 across Block 2
    The return of Token cards


144 unique cards were released as part of the main set: 

    4 Mane Characters, 
    79 Friends, 
    21 Events, 
    16 Resources, 
    5 Troublemakers, and 
    19 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains 

    40 Common (C) cards, 
    40 Uncommon (U) cards, 
    40 Rare (R) cards, 
    11 Super Rare (SR) cards, 
    10 Ultra Rare (UR) cards, and 
    3 Fixed (F) cards. 


There is a 1 in 3 chance for a Marks in Time booster pack to contain a Super Rare, Ultra Rare, or Royal Rare card in place of a Common card.

In addition to the main set, there are also 2 Royal Rare (RR) parallel alternate-art full-card cards. These Royal Rare (RR) versions are full-card (borderless) versions of 2 Ultra Rare cards found in the main set but are otherwise the same as their main set equivalent. There is a 1 in 216 chance for a Marks in Time booster pack to contain a Royal Rare (RR) in place of a Common card (average of 1 per case of 6 booster boxes of 36 booster packs).

The promo set of 11 cards cannot be found in booster packs. All of these Promo (P) cards are alternate-art foiled versions of cards in the main set (none are unique to the promo set).

There are no theme decks released for the Marks in Time set. Instead, there are 3 versions of the Make Your Mark Pack Drafter, meant for use in Limited Draft events.

Name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Defenders of Equestria
Description:
Defenders of Equestria is the name of the eighth set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: June 16, 2017

Defenders of Equestria has 142 new cards and full suite of two-color card support. It is booster-only (no theme decks).

142 unique cards were released as part of the main set: 

    7 Mane Characters, 
    89 Friends, 
    21 Events, 
    8 Resources, 
    7 Troublemakers, and 
    10 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains 

    60 Common (C) cards, 
    30 Uncommon (U) cards, 
    30 Rare (R) cards, 
    11 Super Rare (SR) cards, and 
    11 Ultra Rare (UR) cards 


There are no Fixed (F) cards in this set, since there are no theme decks or other non-booster products for them to be found in.

There is a 1 in 3 chance for a Defenders of Equestria booster pack to contain a Super Rare, Ultra Rare, or Royal Rare card in place of a Common card.

In addition to the main set, there is also 1 Royal Rare (RR) parallel alternate-art full-card card. This Royal Rare (RR) version is a full-card (borderless) version of 1 Ultra Rare card found in the main set but is otherwise the same as its main set equivalent. There is a 1 in 216 chance for a Defenders of Equestria booster pack to contain a Royal Rare (RR) in place of a Common card (average of 1 per case of 6 booster boxes of 36 booster packs).

The promo set of 10 cards cannot be found in booster packs. All of these Promo (P) cards are alternate-art foiled versions of cards in the main set (none are unique to the promo set).

Name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Seaquestria and Beyond
Description:
Seaquestria & Beyond is the name of the ninth set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: November 24, 2017

Seaquestria & Beyond has 142 new cards and six new Mane Characters.

142 unique cards were released as part of the main set: 

    6 Mane Characters, 
    99 Friends, 
    9 Events, 
    15 Resources, 
    5 Troublemakers, and 
    8 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains 

    60 Common (C) cards, 
    30 Uncommon (U) cards, 
    30 Rare (R) cards, 
    11 Super Rare (SR) cards, and 
    11 Ultra Rare (UR) cards 


There are no Fixed (F) cards in this set, since there are no theme decks or other non-booster products for them to be found in.

There is a 1 in 3 chance for a Seaquestria & Beyond booster pack to contain a Super Rare, Ultra Rare, or Royal Rare card in place of a Common card.

In addition to the main set, there is also 1 Royal Rare (RR) parallel alternate-art full-card card. This Royal Rare (RR) version is a full-card (borderless) version of 1 Ultra Rare card found in the main set but is otherwise the same as its main set equivalent. There is a 1 in 216 chance for a Seaquestria & Beyond booster pack to contain a Royal Rare (RR) in place of a Common card (average of 1 per case of 6 booster boxes of 36 booster packs).

The promo set of 10? cards cannot be found in booster packs. All of these Promo (P) cards are alternate-art foiled versions of cards in the main set (none are unique to the promo set).

Name: Seek and Find
Description:
An exciting game to seek out animals that are Out of View and a challenging race against time between your opponent and yourself!

The object of the game is to seek and find the right animal so that you can start collecting scoring bands until you collect all six different colors, one scoring band from each player, you have to seek and find the right animal to collect one of your own color bands as well, in order to win the game.

Play begins by flipping over a card revealing an animal. All players reach into a sack and try to identify the animal by touch before time runs out. Whoever picks the animal shown by the card gets one of the six bands owned by the other players. A new card is then drawn until one player has all six bands.

Name: Sixth Tackle: 2003 Australian NRL Season Cards
Description: Sixteen team cards for the 2003 season of the Australian National Rugby League competition.

Name: Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box
Description: The Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box is a product to support the Deutscher Spielepreis, the second biggest German board game prize, for which thousands of players vote each year between May and July for their favorite game. This box contains small expansions for some of the top ten games of the Deutscher Spielepreis 2018: Azul, Rajas of the Ganges, Altiplano and The Quacks of Quedlinburg.

Name: Dudab Buba
Description:
Prehistoric people were fishing, hunting, and gathering during their wandering. It was important to carry as few things with them as possible in order to move easily. They couldn't speak, but Dudab was one among their primitive words meaning "sorry".

When it's your turn in Dudab Buba, you can choose one of the two possibilities: lay down a card or draw a card. Then the next player's turn in clockwise order starts. Players need to collect as few cards and as few victory points as possible. To do this, they have to be very tactical, and say "Dudab" with proper timing. The player who can lead everybody else by the nose and collect the fewest victory points wins.

The game is a reprint for the original Dudab and contains sixteen extra cards that comprise two expansions.

Name: Yukon
Description:
The Yukon, the biggest river on the North American continent, became famous in the period from 1896 to 1903, when in hope of making a quick fortune prospectors stampeded it. This period is known as the Klondike gold rush, and an estimated 100,000 people were prospecting gold during that time. The gold rush was over almost as quickly as it came, but the people that live there believe that the river still contains plenty of the shiny ore.

In Yukon, you want to be the smartest prospector and collect the most of that valuable gold. But be aware, others also vie for that ore you laid eyes on, the quickest and most vigilant fortune hunter will win.

The playing area consists of a 7x7 card grid. The starting player may decide to take a card from the row or the column that the gold digger is standing in. This card is placed in front of the player, and the gold digger is moved to the spot the card occupied previously. This ends the player's turn. The next players may always take a card moving in a perpendicular direction from the previous movement. The gold digger always moves to the newly freed spot.

The game contains the townsfolk expansion that includes 30 extra cards (10 characters, 3 of each) and 9 gold nugget tokens.

Name: Dungeon Degenerates: Mean Streets Expansion Box
Description:
DUNGEON DEGENERATES: MEAN STREETS brings the corroded cobblestone corridors, Gothic grottoes & towering turrets of the Würstreich into terrifying tangibility.

Featuring 4 new playable characters lifted straight from the seedy streets of the Würstreich; Mendicant Monk, Fugitive Fop, Sickly Soldier & Unlicensed Surgeon, a hefty new deck of Settlement Encounters to make every trip to town unique, engaging & dangerous, new Loot, new Monsters & the new putrescent Plague Mechanic pitting your party of DUNGEON DEGENERATES against two new missions; The Deadly Smell of Disease & The River of Filth!

From the unadulterated urbanity of the fortress city Brüttelburg to the shoddy shanty-towns, unstable stilt-hut hamlets & overripe outposts that cling to civilization with swords, sausages & sorcery, the MEAN STREETS of DUNGEON DEGENERATES are the würst!

What's in the box? DUNGEON DEGENERATES: MEAN STREETS comes with:


     4 playable adventurer character cards which come with their own items & abilities 


standees of each adventurer 

     4 Monster cards 
     2 law cards
     34 Encounter cards 
     16 Loot cards 
     1 Epic Loot card 
     4 Doom cards 
     6 Skill cards 
     3 Danger cards 
     1 Weakness card
     24 20mm counters 
     12 page rulebook 
     Reference card

Name: Von Unaussprechlichen Kulten
Description:
Von Unaussprechlichen Kulten (…or Kulten…or VUK for short) is an horrific, violent and often disturbingly amusing cult battle and management game in which players create cults and clash amongst each other for the favour of their gods; ancient, evil and tenebrous though they may be…

Players may choose between eight different cults:

- Arcane Seekers

- Cult de Ghouls

- Dagonites

- Death Cult

- Dunwich Folk

- Serpent Worshippers

- The Howling

- Vampiric Cabal

Each game of Kulten plays in 30-60 minutes and requires 3-10 models per cult. The option-filled advancement system is fraught with mind and body snapping injuries, madness and other perils as well as shocking dark rewards!

Will you and your twisted brethren reign as the supreme cult? Can you beg, borrow and kill enough to support your deviant flock? What colors should your cult robes be? All important questions that will be answered when you play Von Unaussprechlichen Kulten!

Von Unaussprechlichen Kulten is an adversarial miniatures combat game where two or more factions battle it out to achieve scenario goals or just plain old slaughter each other. Victory goes to the side that best uses the unique abilities of their particular faction to advance their own depraved agenda.

Name: KeyForge: Call of the Archons – Archon Deck
Description: KeyForge: Call of the Archons – Archon Deck consists of a single unique deck created from cards in the Call of the Archons set, the first set of cards in the KeyForge line. Each player must have their own deck in order to play the game.

Name: KUAN
Description:
KUAN is a two-player abstract strategy game using a 5×5 grid board and two types (colors) of pieces. The players take turns placing a piece on the board. Try to trap pieces between those of a different color to capture them.

If your opponent captures some pieces, you must place your pieces on the spots where the captured pieces used to occupy. You win either by placing five pieces of the same color in a straight line or making the opponent unable to place any piece on the board.

Name: Star Realms: Frontiers – Kickstarter Promo Pack
Description:
Promos sent to Kickstarter backers with the Frontiers campaign.

See Wiki Section for full list of cards included.

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Echoes of Death
Description:
Echoes of Death is a small extension for Kingdom Death: Monster, with 4 miniatures (Thief, Mage, Necromancer and Fighter), and a set of rules (the Strain System).

The Strain System introduce a legacy element in KDM (but reversible).

Name: Star Wars: Armada – Super Star Destroyer Expansion Pack
Description:
This expansion pack arrives to swell the forces of the Galactic Empire with the first ship of an entirely new class—huge ships. The pre-painted, beautifully sculpted Super Star Destroyer miniature within this expansion is the largest miniature yet created by Fantasy Flight Games, measuring over 24 inches from tip to tip.

Of course, such a huge miniature serves as a stunning reminder of Imperial might on the battlefield—and it’s also a fully functional warship that you can add to your Imperial fleets. With four unique ship sheets, an assortment of tokens, and twenty-four upgrade cards, including iconic commanders like Admiral Piett and Emperor Palpatine, any rival fleet will tremble to face the might of your onslaught.

Name: Wurstquartett (sausage quartette)
Description:
In this game is all about the sausage!
The card game consists of 32 playing cards. The category with the highest value wins. There are the following categories: fat content, porcine percentage, diameter, price / 100 grams, shelf life, calories.

The object of the game is to collect matching groups of sausages by winning cards from your opponent in classical quartet showdowns.

Wurstquartett ("Sausage Quartets") is a variant of a Quartett game, with a touch of Top Trumps. The aim is to collect four cards of one city -- one Quartett.

The player with three Quartetts wins.

Name: Pickup Lines
Description:
Pickup Lines is a fast paced party game where you try and guess which line the chosen player would use on a specific type of person.

The game itself is pretty simple. Players take turns being the pickup artist in a clockwise order. The pickup artist will draw a random person type card and then place either the male or female version face up in front of them. Other players will then choose from their hand which pickup line they think the pickup artist will use on that person type in front of them. After all players have selected their choice and placed it face down, the pickup artist will shuffle them and then read them one by one out loud. Whoever had the winning line gets to keep that pickup line card face up in front of them creating a score pile. First player to reach 18 points or person with highest score when the pickup lines deck runs out, wins!

Name: Company II
Description:
The object of Company II is gain the most power by capturing as many enemy marines as possible and also have the most remaining men of your own in the battlefield when the game is over. Game contains 216 pieces (All made of color stained, stamped, wood).

Only five-hundred copies of this game were produced. The artwork on the box was commissioned locally at a cost of seven hundred dollars.

—user summary

Name: Das Kalispiel
Description:
The players start at space 1 and the first player to reach space 31 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: The Devil's Own Day
Description:
The Devil’s Own Day is a 2 player war game depicting the events of the Battle of Shiloh on April 6th and 7th, 1862. While certainly not the bloodiest battle of the war, it may well be the battle that set the tone of what a Civil War was really going to cost.

NOTE:
This game was designed as part of an ONE WEEK design challenge. Including all testing. I can not guarantee it is balanced.

You have been warned.

—description from the publisher
Families: Contests: Nathan Hansen 52 Game Design Challenge

Name: Game of Mother Goose
Description:
Unique game, but similar in play to Chutes & Ladders. Rules suggest that "Any number" can play, but I think that 6 would be maximum number of players. Players spin a 6-space spinner to advance 1-6 spaces on the board and then respond to penalties or rewards in that space. The first player to the center of the board wins. Many house rules exist: such as "Capture" & Needing exact number to land on winning space...

—user summary

Name: Daughters of Nyx
Description:
The Daughters of Nyx is a 3 player game about determining the Fate of 3 mortal heroes.

NOTE:
This game was designed as part of an ONE WEEK design challenge. Including all testing. I can not guarantee it is balanced.

You have been warned.

—description from the publisher
Families: Contests: Nathan Hansen 52 Game Design Challenge

Name: Death of the Mountain King
Description:
The olde King is Dead. Time to choose the new King.

Players take turns playing claim cards face down on the three heirs to the throne, placing an influence cube for each card they play. Each claim card has a value which is scored at the game end. The player with the most influence on the heir who claims the throne wins the game.

NOTE:
This game was designed as part of an ONE WEEK design challenge. Including all testing.

I can not guarantee it is balanced.

You have been warned.

—description from the publisher
Families: Contests: Nathan Hansen 52 Game Design Challenge

Name: Aotearoa
Description:
Sometime around the year 1300 AD the Maori people began settling the islands of New Zealand, a land they called Aotearoa. This is a game about their initial settlement for 2 to 4 players.

Ki te kahore he whakakitenga ka ngaro te iwi
Without foresight or vision the people will be lost.

NOTE:
This game was designed as part of an ONE WEEK design challenge. Including all testing.

I can not guarantee it is balanced.

You have been warned.

—description from the publisher
Families: Contests: Nathan Hansen 52 Game Design Challenge

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark Heroes I
Description:
The Starks are known to be dependable, resilient, and above all, loyal. This goes double for their leaders. These warriors from House Stark lead the armies of the North in the War of the Five Kings. Each one under the Direwolf banner is an expert in some part of military engagement. Rodrik Cassel and Howland Reed can lead individual units on specialized roles. Brynden Tully and Eddard Stark are at home controlling the overall force with tactics and strategy. The presence of Bran Stark and his companion Hodor and the direwolf Summer, are enough to instill courage in the troops and make them hold the line. All of the characters in the Stark Heroes set for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game will come in handy in the war for the fate of Westeros.

The A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark Heroes I box contains six different Character miniatures, a movement tray for Summer, and thirty-four associated cards.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: The Quest for El Dorado: Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack for The Quest for El Dorado contains 3 new sets of cards for the game:

     Powerful Paddle (3 copies)
     Binoculars (3 copies)
     Brute (3 copies)


This promo pack was originally available at Gen Con 2018 from publisher Ravensburger with Franz Vohwinkel artwork in both an English and German version.  It was later made available in Spielbox 4 (end of July), 2018 and the BGG store.  Beginning in 2019, this promo pack has slowly been released in a number of different languages with Vincent Dutrait artwork (Polish, Russian, Hungarian, Korean, Dutch, and English as of this writing).

GAME RULES
Set up the base game as usual. Add the three new expedition cards to the 12 card piles next to the market board.

POWERFUL PADDLE
Helps with crossing rivers.

BINOCULARS
Choose a card on the Market board and copy its effect as if you were playing it. Then remove the Binoculars from the game, but leave the chosen card on the market board.

BRUTE 
You can't use this card to move onto a space with one or two symbols.  Ignore any requirements of the target space (see Native). The Brute allows you to move onto a space which is occupied by another playing piece.
Families: Game: The Quest for El Dorado

Name: Mostradamus
Description: Mostradamus is a party game for teams of two or more players. The goal of the game is to obtain more "Mostras" points than the other team. In each round, a player tries to get his teammates to guess as many words as possible in 2 minutes, by drawing and closing its eyes, humming, miming, etc. depending on the results of a dice. Besides, a team can score points by guessing the number of words that will be by the other team.

Name: Monopoly: Traditional Japanese Art & Crafts Edition
Description:
Created by Nakagawa Masashichi Shoten, this truly brilliant Monopoly Traditional Japanese Arts & Crafts Edition is a must for board game enthusiasts and fans of Japanese crafts. This is the universally popular Monopoly game, only with pieces and a board adapted to Japan. So you get deer, the maneki-neko (beckoning cat) and daruma instead of the usual tokens of a hat, iron and boot. Rather than the standard community chest and chance cards, you have Zipangu and Future cards.

Learn about traditional Japan while playing the classic game. The locations on the board are businesses, shops and studios dealing in crafts, such as ceramics, paper and more. Complete with bilingual (English and Japanese) cards, the board is also beautifully decorated.

Limited edition of 5,000

Bilingual cards (English and Japanese)
Instructions: Japanese (but regular Monopoly rules and bilingual cards)

Name: BATTLE: Superheroes vs. Villains
Description:
Battle is a card game between Superheroes and Villains.  The Superheroes are trying to save the world, while the Villains are trying to achieve world domination.  The game is played in 2 phases.  The first phase provides an opportunity for each player to build a strong fighting hand (numbered cards).  The second phase is using the fighting hand to win the battle!  Once players are able to get rid of their fight cards, they can play their identity card on their next turn.  If a Superhero saves the world, all the Superheroes win.  If a Villain achieves world domination, all the Villains win.

Players try to improve their hand in the first phase by drawing and discarding cards.  Once the BATTLE card is randomly flipped up from the middle deck, the battle begins (second phase).  The player that flipped the BATTLE card will lay down a numbered card.  The next player must match or beat the number laid.  There are action cards mixed in to keep things interesting!

Name: Galatune: Duality
Description:
Galatune: Duality is a new 2-player stand-alone game that is fully compatible with other Galatune games. Use Duality alone for intense 1v1 battles, combine two Duality decks for up to 4 players, or combine with our 2016 Galatune Starter Deck to support insane free-for-all brawls for up to 8-player battles, or even more players if you combine multiple sets.

Duality includes everything you need to support 2 players in 1v1 battles. 9 new holographic Champions cards, 48 new action cards, no duplicates, no filler, tons of incredible American anime art. All our cards are large 2.75 x4.75 inches (standard tarot size) with high-quality materials. One vs. One, Light vs. Darkness, opposing powers and conflicting factions compete to shape the future of Planet Lyra.

Galatune is an anime battle tabletop card game set on the fantasy planet of Lyra. The United World Government maintains peace and prosperity through the monopoly of advanced ancient technologies, but utopia comes at a steep cost. Will you join with the government to protect unity, or will you join the rebels and fight for freedom and independence?

2-5 players each lead a Champion warrior into battle and earn a Victory Point each time an opponent is defeated. You win the game by being the first to earn 3 Victory Points by defeating 3 opponents. BUT there's a twist! The game doesn't end for you when your Champion falls in battle. Instead, you just get back up on your feet, respawn your Champion, and continue fighting! Think of it as a sort of card-based battle-royal, like a Battle Arena game, where you play for KOs.

Unlike other battle card games where players take their turns one-at-a-time, in Galatune everyone attacks simultaneously! It's an exciting formula that keeps the game moving and encourages players to predict and react to each other in real time.

Great game for first-time gamers or serious pros! Easy-to-Learn, impossible to master!

Name: The Red Dragon Inn 7: The Tavern Crew Collector's Edition
Description:
The Collector’s Edition includes content not found in the standard Kickstarter edition:


     8 Promo Drinks Cards (includes 2 new Kickstarter Promos that will be in all backer rewards. The Collector’s Edition will also include 2 new Promo Drinks that will be released later on in 2019 or thereafter for other promotions plus an additional 4 reprints that were never offered on Kickstarter before):


- Ettinbrau
- The Good Stuff! (*)
- Half-Ogre Brew (+)
- Iron Guts Lager
- Ozrikâ€™s Powerale (+)
- Purified Potent Pixie Power Punch
- Wizgilleâ€™s Phenomenale
- Ye Olde Drink ’n’ Dice (*)
    

     4 Bonus Red Dragon Inn Drink Coasters
     Enamel Inlay Dragon’s Breath Ale Turn Marker
     Collector’s Edition Box (or not, if the Eco-Collector’s Edition)


(*) Also in the Kickstarter Edition.
(+) Previously released.

Name: Multi Stacks
Description:
Multi-Stacks is a cooperative game that can be played with a regular 52-card playing deck.  Players work together to beat the deck rather than each other.  It is quick to play and easy to learn.  The goal is simple: work together to use all the cards in player's hands before running out of cards in the deck.

Every turn consists of three phases: Draw, Play, Pass.  Each player will have to choose how many cards to draw, which cards to play on the stacks, and which cards to pass to fellow players.  Roles limit what cards can be played so that players have to depend on each other.  Work together to keep yourself and your teammates from getting stuck with cards you cannot play.  If everyone gets stuck, you lose.  Play all the cards in your hands to win the game!

Name: Bad Doctor: Gen Con 2018 Promo Pack
Description:
Bad Doctor Promo Pack from Gen Con 2018

Includes:

1 new Patient Tile called CON CRUD which has two "WILD" sides

1 new Treatment Tile called GEN CON BALLOON MASSAGE that has two "WILD" sides and allows the visiting doctor to Draw one additional Treatment Tile.

Name: Hunt for the Ring: Frodo Baggins Promo Card
Description:
Alternate Frodo Baggins Company Card given out during conventions including GenCon 2018. Later available as part of the Game Boy Geek Season 12 (2024) Kickstarter.

It is the same art as the one that comes in the base game, but a different ability on the card.

Card abilities:

During a Nazgul Encounter, if you must draw more than one Corruption tile, spend one Fellowship token (only one) to draw one tile less.

Frodo's Resolve: After moving, flip this card to move again. Reduce the Fellowship pool by 1 token.

Name: Clank! In! Space!: W.H.I.S.K.E.R.S.
Description:
Promo card given out during Gen Con 2018 at Dire Wolf's booth.

Cost 2; Worth 1 VP

Card Effect

Choose One: -2 Clank! /or/ Take a black cube /or/ Take a Cyberware from your discard pile into your hand.

Name: Clank! In! Space!: Apocalypse! – Planetary Destruction
Description:
Category 3 Scheme given out during Gen Con 2018 at Renegade Games' booth.

Flavor Text: Lord Eradikus has created a weapon that can destroy a planet. If it doesn't work, he'll build a bigger, stronger one... and another one after that.

Player ability:

Divert Power - Spend 3 Skill to take a black cube. Then, if you're in the Doomsday Cannon module, gain 1 Credit.

Scheme Phases:

1. Issue Ultimatum - Turn all major secrets on the board face up.
2. Acquire Target - All players get +3 Clank!
3. Commence Primary Ignition - All players are knocked out.
